newsitem.title: GERMANY: BMW seeking to raise U.S. vehicle sales.
newsitem.headline: BMW seeking to raise U.S. vehicle sales.

text.p: German carmaker BMW AG hopes to deliver about 110,000 vehicles to customers in the United States during 1997, up from 105,800 in 1996.

A BMW spokesman confirmed comments by the new top executive for BMW in the U.S., Henrich Heitmann, to the trade magazine "PS Report" that BMW was seeking to step up its presence in the North American market.
Heitmann told the magazine that about 50 percent of BMW's business in the U.S. was in vehicle leasing.
He also said BMW was against developing its own sport utility vehicle and would instead rely on the Land Rover and Range Rover models developed by BMW unit Rover of Britain.
Heitmann's comments came as BMW on Monday said July U.S. car sales were flat at 10,769 models but that sales for the first seven months of the year were up 21 percent at 73,170 vehicles.
